criteria.name: Market Share
criteria.description: The percentage of total sales within the communications equipment industry held by a company.
criteria.reason: Market share indicates competitiveness and business success in the industry.

data_points.name: Total Sales Volume
data_points.description: Overall sales of the company in the communications equipment sector.

data_points.name: Industry Total Sales
data_points.description: Aggregate sales from all companies in the communications equipment sector.

normalized_data_points.name: Growth Rate
normalized_data_points.formula: (Current Year Sales - Previous Year Sales) / Previous Year Sales

key_points: Monitor highest market shares for potential acquisitions.
Analyze trends in market share over several years.
Compare market shares against main competitors.
Investigate factors contributing to market share gains or losses.
Look for emerging players in the communications equipment space.

charts.usage: A pie chart allows for a visual representation of market share distribution among major companies in the industry, helping to quickly identify market leaders.
A bar graph is useful for depicting market share changes over time, allowing comparisons of growth rates between companies.

criteria.name: Product Innovation
criteria.description: The rate at which new and improved products are developed and introduced to the market.
criteria.reason: Innovative products drive sales and keep companies competitive in a fast-paced industry.

data_points.name: Number of Patents Filed
data_points.description: Total patents related to communications equipment technology filed by the company.

data_points.name: R&D Spending
data_points.description: Investment in research and development in relation to sales.

normalized_data_points.name: Innovation Cycle Time
normalized_data_points.formula: Time taken from product concept to market launch

key_points: Identify key innovations and their impact on market share.
Review historical R&D spending and its correlation with sales growth.
Examine competitor innovation strategies.
Track industry trends towards technological advancements.
Analyze customer feedback on new product features.

charts.usage: Line charts can show the trend of R&D spending and its correlation with product launches over time.
Histograms can be employed to visualize the distribution of new patents filed across the industry, showing peaks of innovation.

criteria.name: Regulatory Compliance
criteria.description: Adherence to laws and regulations relating to communications technology and equipment.
criteria.reason: Compliance ensures the company avoids legal issues and maintains operational integrity.

data_points.name: Compliance Audits Passed
data_points.description: Frequency of successful compliance audits conducted.

data_points.name: Number of Regulatory Penalties
data_points.description: Count and cost of penalties incurred due to non-compliance.

normalized_data_points.name: Time to Resolve Compliance Issues
normalized_data_points.formula: Average days to rectify compliance discrepancies

key_points: Evaluate the impact of compliance on operational costs.
Investigate regulatory changes and their business implications.
Review penalties history and its impact on brand reputation.
Monitor compliance training initiatives for employees.
Assess risk management strategies related to compliance.

charts.usage: Bar charts can compare the number of compliance audits passed against the total audits dynamically.
A bubble chart can illustrate the relationship between compliance penalty amounts and company revenue.

criteria.name: Customer Satisfaction
criteria.description: Measurement of how products meet customer expectations and experiences.
criteria.reason: High customer satisfaction can lead to repeat business and brand loyalty.

data_points.name: NPS Score
data_points.description: Net Promoter Score indicating likelihood of customers to recommend products.

data_points.name: Customer Retention Rate
data_points.description: Percentage of customers that continue to use the company’s products.

normalized_data_points.name: Average Support Response Time
normalized_data_points.formula: Total response time / Total support requests

key_points: Analyze NPS trends and correlate them with sales data.
Review customer feedback to identify improvement areas.
Monitor competitor customer satisfaction ratings.
Investigate customer churn reasons to enhance retention.
Consider customer surveys as tools for product improvement.

charts.usage: Line graphs can help track NPS scores over time to visualize improvements or declines.
Scatter plots can show the correlation between customer satisfaction and sales growth, indicating potential relationships.

criteria.name: Operational Efficiency
criteria.description: Evaluation of the efficiency with which resources are utilized in producing output.
criteria.reason: Efficiency can lead to cost reductions and improved profitability.

data_points.name: Cost of Goods Sold (COGS)
data_points.description: The total direct costs of manufacturing goods sold.

key_points: Calculate key operational metrics regularly for insights.
Benchmark efficiency ratios against industry standards.
Assess impact of automation on operational efficiency.
Review training programs for employee productivity initiatives.
Explore best practices from high-performing peers.

charts.usage: Radar charts can effectively show comparison between multiple operational efficiency metrics across different companies.
Gantt charts can illustrate project timelines and resource allocations for operational improvements.

criteria.name: Supply Chain Robustness
criteria.description: Assessment of supply chain strength and reliability in delivering products efficiently.
criteria.reason: A robust supply chain enhances production flexibility and reduces costs and disruptions.

data_points.name: Days Inventory Outstanding (DIO)
data_points.description: Average number of days inventory is held before sold.

data_points.name: Vendor On-Time Delivery Rate
data_points.description: Percentage of products delivered by suppliers on time.

normalized_data_points.name: Inventory Turnover Ratio
normalized_data_points.formula: Cost of Goods Sold / Average Inventory

normalized_data_points.name: Supply Chain Cost as Percentage of Sales
normalized_data_points.formula: Total Supply Chain Costs / Total Revenue

normalized_data_points.name: Total Lead Time
normalized_data_points.formula: Average time taken from order placement to delivery

key_points: Evaluate suppliers for reliability and performance.
Analyze inventory management tactics for efficiency.
Monitor lead times and their effect on responsiveness.
Measure cost impacts from supply chain disruptions.
Consider implementing dual sourcing strategies for critical components.

charts.usage: Stacked bar charts can show inventory levels over time across different components to identify trends.
Flow charts can visualize the supply chain process, helping to identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies.

criteria.name: Competitive Landscape
criteria.description: Analysis of competitors within the communications equipment industry.
criteria.reason: Understanding competitors allows companies to identify opportunities and threats in the market.

data_points.name: Market Position of Competitors
data_points.description: Analysis of where each competitor stands in the market based on sales and innovation.

data_points.name: Competitor Pricing Models
data_points.description: Research on competitors’ pricing for similar products.

normalized_data_points.name: Market Share Comparison
normalized_data_points.formula: Market Share of Company / Market Share of Competitor

key_points: Conduct regular competitor analyses to understand market shifts.
Monitor competitor product launches and marketing efforts.
Evaluate competitor strengths and weaknesses thoroughly.
Maintain an updated SWOT analysis for major competitors.
Compare pricing strategies to inform competitive pricing of own products.

charts.usage: A matrix provides a clear side-by-side comparison of key competitors based on important metrics like market share and product offerings.
A SWOT analysis chart visually represents competitors’ strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats, providing insight into strategic positioning.
